docs.title: Inanna Project
docs.text: The Inanna Project is an effort to make a lightweight, native chat app, with features that users have come to expect in their chats, such as voice and video calls. Something like "IRC that you'd actually want to use in 2024."

docs.title: Docs, Goals, Et Cetera
docs.text:
The list of targeted features for the client can be found here: Client Feature TODO

The list of targeted features for the server/backend can be found here: Server Feature TODO

These are dynamic lists and features may be added, removed, decided against, or suddenly implemented at any time.

docs.title: Client Feature TODO
docs.text:
• channelized server based user experience
  • discord-style ui?
  • simple enough your mom can use it with a normal amount of walkthrough
  • dedicated desktop client
  • web client????
  • voice channels
    • video over voice channels?
  • text channels
    • image embeds (just a link to a spot on the server prolly)
  • moderation tools
    • designatable permissions
    • voice mute
    • read-only perms
    • a perm structure that doesn't suck (additive maybe?)
    • roles?
    • kick/ban abilities
  • multiplatform
    • windows
    • mac (this is hecks's and only hecks's)
    • linux??????????
    • nog would like tui client available plox (willing to work on it)

docs.title: Server Feature TODO
docs.text:
• config shouldn't be too asinine
  • setup should be docker based
  • IRCd-based. (What does this require for feature-complete? Backfill this)
  • voice/video caht -- likely just use CloudFlare Calls, at least for now
